Articles.Content: I use MechJeb a lot, but I am quite confused at how to use the Spaceplane Guidance. Whenever I try to use it, it always crashes the spaceplane.

Either DON'T use FAR/NEAR or land by hands. Current spaceplane landing sequence is incapable of safe landing with aerodynamic mods installed. And noone in MJ team is currently working on better algorithm.
I've had some luck with it. It works better in powered landings. I have found it easier though to just go in hands on. Just use the ILS guidance.
AFAIK, you should line up your plane yourself and approach at the right height. When all that is OK, it can land automatically.
Hmmm...First of all, I am not using FAR or NEAR, and I am not particularly good at landing a spaceplane by hand. Can anyone recommend a mod thad has even a half-decent spaceplane guidance?

Hmmm...First of all, I am not using FAR or NEAR, and I am not particularly good at landing a spaceplane by hand. Can anyone recommend a mod thad has even a half-decent spaceplane guidance?

Nope; there isn't one, although mods like DaMichel's Kerbal Flight Indicators that provide a HUD make it easier. Just plant your prograde marker on the end of the runway and cruise in.

But it's not too hard; you just need to learn to fly. See post #2 in the Kerbodyne thread linked below. It's written for FAR, but the same basic techniques work in stock.

If you're having trouble building something flyable, see https://www.dropbox.com/s/lbnz9s8k9h7gwgb/Kerbodyne%20Benchmark%20StockAir.craft?dl=0 for an easy stock aero trainer.

Edited November 7, 2014 by Wanderfound

Also adjust your center of lift slightly forward of cog (for a slower landing speed). center of lift aft of COG will mean you'll need more speed to keep from stalling and can make it harder to get a good touchdown. As said before mechjeb is better at powered landings I have found with a COL forward of the COG that 6 degree glide slope works well. and kill the throttle when your just short of the runway.
